title: Everest Base Camp
desc: Considered to be one of the most breathtaking and magical places on Earth, the Mt. Everest Base Camp trek continues to be a must-see destination for people from all over the world. The Gokyo Ri or Gokyo Lakes Trek can be the optional trek plan for Everest Base Camp because of the wide Himalayan range view and the Gokyo Lake. The duration of the Gokyo Lakes trek is also similar or can be customized.

title: Annapurana Circuit Trek
desc: Annapurna Circuit Trekking is known as one of the longest Pass trekking trails in the world and offers an incredible experience to hikers. This trek shares all that Nepal has to offer, Many Annapurna circuit treks start from Besisahar, but nowadays, because of the roadways, trekkers drive directly to Chamje or Syange. Heading through the rugged trail, it reaches Manang village. Tibetan Buddhism has a significant influence on it. The climb over Thorong La Pass reaches an elevation of 17,769 feet and is a challenging yet beautiful highlight of the trip.

title: Manaslu Circuit Trek
desc: Manaslu Circuit Trek joins the Annapurna region with the Manaslu region, and you truly get the best of both. Many guides say the trail is comparable to the Annapurna Circuit Trek, but with fewer tourists. The amazing scenery never stops. From the forests teeming with life at the beginning of the trail to the barren, rocky landscape above the clouds, you will constantly be in awe.

title: Langtang Gosaikunda Trek
desc: Combined with the Langtang Valley Trek, the trek to Langtang Gosaikunda begins in Syabrubesi and heads along the ridge of the Langtang Khola River. Crossing the ethnic villages like Lama Hotel and Chyamki, it enters the Langtang valley, which is described as one of the most beautiful valleys in the world.

title: Rara Lake Trek
desc: The Rara Lake, the centrepiece of the Rara National Park, lies at an altitude of 2,990 m (9,810 ft) above sea level and is also an ideal location for bird watchers. Nepal's largest lake, Rara Lake, is 5 km long and 3 km wide, with a maximum depth of 167 km.

title: Upper Mustang Trek
desc: Without a doubt, the Upper Mustang Trek is among the top trek routes in Nepal. Our country is widely known for high alpine trekking, which is why the Upper Mustang trail is so notable. Yes, you still get views of towering peaks and rugged ridges, but this path gives you much more than that. The ethnic groups and landscape of the Upper Mustang region cannot be found anywhere else. To this day, many locals carry out a traditional way of life, including the way in which they practice Tibetan Buddhism.

title: Annapurna Base Camp Trek
desc: Himalayan ranges that include Annapurna, Dhaulagiri, and Machhapurchre surround the Annapurna base camp trek. This region is also famous for the Kali Gandi River, which is known as the world's deepest gorge and is famous for rafting. About 2/3 of the tourists in Nepal make their first choice in the Annapurna region, which is easily accessible.

title: Manaslu Circuit Trek
desc: Manaslu Circuit Trek joins the Annapurna region with the Manaslu region, and you truly get the best of both. Many guides say the trail is comparable to the Annapurna Circuit Trek, but with fewer tourists. The amazing scenery never stops. From the forests teeming with life at the beginning of the trail to the barren, rocky landscape above the clouds, you will constantly be in awe.
